page.title: 16Getting About
page.content: Most Taddington families have cars. The older people mainly use the buses. They have passes and can travel half fare.It is expensive for families to use the buses.The teenaged boys have motor bikes,but not any girls.A lot of children have bicycles,but they don't ride far on them. To get to London now,you have to change buses at Derby.You can get to Mancheaster or Nottingham without a change on the Trans-Peak buses which are painted half blue and half green with woodland scenes on the sides. The bus times are not really convenient for getting to and from work.The secondary schoolchildren go on contract buses.We have several bus stops but not one shelter,and we do have a lot of rain.The Chesterfield bus doesn't go through the village so people have to go to the A6 for it.
